content:
advertisement

As sororities in the Panhellenic Council begin the recruitment process many women boost their wardrobes before pledging PERIOD

They may not all choose the same sorority and they may not all decide to pledge but this years sorority recruits can agree on one part of the process appearance matters PERIOD

As girls navigate through dozens of meetings called  with current sorority members they understand the importance of a first impression PERIOD

 Panhellenic Council president Krista Eck said PERIOD 

Jane Neitz assistant director of fraternity and sorority life said nervousness about appearance is normal during the recruitment process because the appearance is widely considered an important attribute PERIOD

 Neitz said PERIOD 

Most girls said the hardest part of primping for the parties is deciding what to wear PERIOD

 Danielle Klein freshmandivision of undergraduate studies said PERIOD

Klein said that although she was concerned about what type of clothes she should wear she did not go out and spend any money on expanding her wardrobe PERIOD

 Klein said PERIOD

She said she knew before she arrived at Penn State that she was going to rush and planned accordingly PERIOD

To prepare for the eight days of recruitment Amy Minogue freshmanpremedicine said she needed to go out and buy more clothing PERIOD

 she said PERIOD 

Eck said a first impression is important but buying new clothes is not necessary PERIOD

 she said PERIOD 

Heather Laubscher freshmanaccounting said she was overwhelmed by the number of girls who seemed to be wearing expensive clothing and had spent extra money preparing for recruitment PERIOD

 she said PERIOD 

Laubscher also said she thought the sororities were looking for girls who look similar to current members PERIOD

She added that she thought some girls who did not look a particular way or fit a description tended to feel out of place when pledging certain sororities PERIOD

 Laubscher said PERIOD 

Neitz said the most important part of recruitment is for each girl to be herself and find a sorority in which she feels comfortable PERIOD

 Neitz said PERIOD

 she added PERIOD

Neitz said she hopes that all sororities judge the girls based on their inner qualities and personalities and not based on the way they look or other superficial grounds PERIOD

 Neitz said PERIOD 

Some recruits agreed that it is more important to be themselves than to look their best during the recruitment and pledging processes regardless of appearances PERIOD

 Klein said PERIOD
